discrimination or harassment.","Please confirm our discussion by email."],"rights":[{"title":"Protection from Discrimination","description":"Your employer cannot treat you unfairly because of your race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. This includes hiring, firing, pay, promotions, and day-to-day treatment. Discrimination based on pregnancy is also illegal. Document all incidents with dates and witnesses.","source":"Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964","stateVariations":[{"state":"CA","note":"FEHA expands protection to include sexual orientation, gender identity, and status as transgender"},{"state":"NY","note":"NY Human Rights Law includes sexual orientation, gender identity, and marital status"},{"state":"TX","note":"Follows federal Title VII; no additional state-level protections"},{"state":"FL","note":"Florida Civil Rights Act follows federal model; limited additional protections"}]},{"title":"Right to File a Complaint with EEOC","description":"The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) is a federal agency that investigates discrimination complaints. You can file for free. You typically must file within 180-300 days depending on your state. Filing triggers an investigation into your employer's practices.","source":"Title VII and EEOC Authority (29 U.S.C. Â§ 706)","stateVariations":[{"state":"CA","note":"180-day deadline; can also file with California Department of Fair Employment and Housing (DFEH)"},{"state":"NY","note":"300-day deadline; can file with NY Division of Human Rights instead of EEOC"},{"state":"TX","note":"180-day deadline from discrimination date"},{"state":"UT","note":"180-day deadline; Utah Labor Commission handles state complaints"},{"state":"FL","note":"180-day deadline or 300 days with state civil rights agency"}]},{"title":"Right to Reasonable Accommodation","description":"If you have a disability, your employer must make reasonable changes to help you do your jobâ€”like flexible scheduling, accessible bathrooms, or equipment modificationsâ€”unless it causes undue hardship. This includes mental health conditions and temporary disabilities. Request accommodation in writing when possible.","source":"Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) of 1990","stateVariations":[{"state":"CA","note":"FEHA has broader disability definition than federal ADA; more generous accommodations required"}]},{"title":"Protection from Retaliation","description":"Your employer cannot punish you for reporting discrimination, harassment, unsafe conditions, or illegal activity. Retaliation includes termination, demotion, reduced hours, or any negative employment action. Report retaliation immediately to your HR or a lawyer.","source":"Title VII Anti-Retaliation Provision (42 U.S.C. Â§ 2000e-3)","stateVariations":[]},{"title":"Right to Equal Pay","description":"Men and women must receive equal pay for equal work. Equal work means jobs requiring the same skill, effort, and responsibility performed under similar working conditions. If you discover a pay gap, you can file a claim. Keep records of your pay and comparable employees' pay if you know it.","source":"Equal Pay Act of 1963","stateVariations":[{"state":"CA","note":"California Equal Pay Act requires equal pay for 'substantially similar' work; broader than federal law"},{"state":"NY","note":"NY law prohibits pay discrimination and requires transparency about pay ranges"}]}]},"availableStates":["CA","FL","NY","TX","UT"]}]}],"$L4"]}],null,"$L5"]}],"loading":null,"isPartial":false}
